item.title: NAMAKORIUM launches in Early Access on January 30
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Underwater cooperative real-time strategy game dated.

Underwater cooperative real-time strategy game NAMAKORIUM will launch in Early Access or PC via Steam on January 30 for 1,500 yen, developer Polyscape announced. A launch discount price of 1,200 yen will be available for a limited time.

The Early Access version significantly expands upon the content from the previously released demo, featuring a total of eight stages with varying difficulty levels. A new Random Match feature allows players to enjoy cooperative play even when playing solo. The game will continue to be updated towards its full release, incorporating player feedback.

Polyscape also launched a Campfire crowdfunding campaign seeking 500,000 yen (approx. $3,177 USD) to expand NAMAKORIUM as a global intellectual property through plushies, figures, and more. The campaign was inspired by player feedback from the demo, such as “The Namakos are cute” and “I want merchandise.” The money raised will be used to mass produce plushies and figures, as well as fund international public relations efforts. This intellectual property and global expansion will proceed in parallel with the Early Access launch.

Here is an overview of the game, via Polyscape:

About

NAMAKORIUM is a chaotic, cooperative multiplayer real-time strategy for up to four players. Command the “sea cleaners”—Namakos (sea cucumbers) left behind by humanity—and clean up the polluted oceans!

Can you reclaim the beautiful sea? It’s all up to your planning skills, your friends, and your trusty sea cucumbers. Get ready for a frantic, action-packed ocean cleanup operation!

Organize Your Namako Operation

Command unique Namakos, gather resources, construct buildings, and clear paths—the tasks are many and time is short.
Purify all the pollution before the food runs out!

Will your strategy hold up under pressure and succeed with the team?

Unique Namakos with Special Traits

Shell Namako gathers limestone. Iron Namako is great at mining. Flame Namako and Ice Namako can survive extreme temperatures.

Use their distinct abilities to assign roles and conquer each stage together!

Restore the Ocean’s Beauty

As you decontaminate, corals bloom, sunlight shines through, and the ocean regains vibrant color.

Over 40 types of “Scenic Creatures” will begin to swim in—try to collect them all as you heal the seas!

Beware the “Blight Namako”!

During cleanup, corrupted Namako known as “Blight Namako” may suddenly appear.

They rot your food and drag the ocean back into darkness.

Team up and repel them with the mighty Namako Fusion Cannon!

Key Features

  • Planning x Real-Time Strategy Gameplay – Strategize based on map structure and control multiple cucumbers simultaneously
  • Chaotic Cooperative Play – Plans may succeed… or hilariously fail—every match brings its own story
  • Online Multiplayer – Join with friends or random players via “Friend Match” or “Random Match.”
  • Over 40 Scenic Creatures – Discover real and fantasy species as you play.
  • Eight unique stages.
  • Stage titles based on clear time.
  • Adorable sea cucumbers a a hidden post-apocalyptic worldview.
  • More stages, gimmicks, and creatures are planned in future updates!

item.title: The Brew Barons now available for PS5
item.content:encoded:
• PS5

Porco Rosso-inspired arcade flight simulation game.

Lifetap Studios has released a PlayStation 5 version of Porco Rosso-inspired open-world arcade flight simulation game The Brew Barons via PlayStation Store for $21.99, the developer announced.

The Brew Barons first launched for PC via Steam on March 1, 2024.

Here is an overview of the game, via Lifetap Studios:

About

A tranquil world becomes ever more corrupt by the day, spoiled by a strong-armed pirate organization that forcefully impose their brewing monopoly over the lands. Armed with your own brewery and seaplane, it’s up to you to explore, forage, craft, sell and deliver your handcrafted brews with aid from fellow pilots who’ve joined your cause to overthrow the corrupt pirate organization and restore peace.

Key Features

  • Assemble your plane from a variety of parts, each with their own traits.
  • Chose your pilot and copilot of whom have strengths and weaknesses.
  • Explore the world in search of ingredients to bring back to your brewery.
  • Pick and choose which foraged ingredients to blend.
  • Distill and / or Ferment, each producing a different outcome.
  • Design and name your bottle to your liking.
  • Design your very own bar to sell your brews and bring fame to your establishment!
  • With fame comes special delivery orders from other bars to stock your brew.

item.title: LoveR Kiss: Endless Memories – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition launches April 30 in Japan
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

A 1,100 yen upgrade from the Switch version.

LoveR Kiss: Endless Memories – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition will launch on April 30 in Japan for 7,590 yen, developer Dragami Games announced. Users who own the Switch version will be able to upgrade via an “Upgrade Pack” for 1,100 yen.

LoveR Kiss: Endless Memories first launched for Switch in Japan and PC via GOG worldwide on November 27, 2025. The PC version is also available via DLsite in Japan.

Here is an overview of the Nintendo Switch 2 Edition, via Dragami Games:

In the Nintendo Switch 2 Edition, the maximum number of characters that can be photographed simultaneously in PRO Photo Session has been expanded from two to up to seven characters. Visual quality and frame rate have also been enhanced to take full advantage of Nintendo Switch 2 hardware, delivering a smoother and higher-quality photography experience. Mouse-style controls using Joy-Con 2 are supported throughout the game for intuitive operation.

An Upgrade Pack is planned for players who already own the Nintendo Switch version. Existing save data and downloadable content can be used seamlessly, allowing players to continue their experience without interruption.

The physical edition includes a first-print bonus downloadable content costume, “Race Queen” (working title). A preliminary design visual is being revealed for the first time. Look forward to this sporty, stylish, and sexy new costume.

item.title: Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition launches March 26 in Japan
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

A 1,100 yen upgrade from the Switch version.

Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition will launch on March 26 in Japan for 7,590 yen, developer Dragami Games announced. Users who own the Switch version will be able to upgrade via an “Upgrade Pack” for 1,100 yen.

Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP first launched for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC via Steam on September 12, 2024, followed by PlayStation 4 and Xbox One on December 2, 2024. Total sales surpassed 300,000 units on August 12, 2025.

The Nintendo Switch 2 Edition features “numerous” graphical enhancements not present in the Switch version, as well as “significantly improved” performance at a stable 60 frames per second in both handheld and docked modes.

This version of the game also introduces the Switch 2-exclusive mode “Gun Shooting Mode,” which is unlocked after clearing either “RePOP Mode” or “ORIGINAL Mode.” In it, players will face waves of oncoming zombies across three “WAVE” phases per stage, using the Chainsaw Blaster as a fixed turret to fend off enemies in an arcade-style mini-game format. Mouse-style aiming with the Joy-Con 2 controller is supported.

item.title: Duskfade ‘Gameplay’ trailer
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Shatter the shackles of time.

Publisher Fireshine Games and developer Weird Beluga Studio have released a new gameplay trailer for 3D action platformer Duskfade.

Here is an overview of the game, via Fireshine Games:

A nostalgic 3D action-platformer inspired by the golden era of PS2 is capturing the attention of fans and creators alike.

Duskfade is an upcoming 3D action-platformer inspired by the golden age of PlayStation games, drawing clear influence from classics like Jak and Daxter, Ratchet & Clank, and Kingdom Hearts. Built with modern technology but rooted in old-school design, Duskfade blends fast-paced platforming, expressive worlds, and stylish combat into a heartfelt throwback adventure.

Designed as a love letter to players who grew up on PlayStation, Duskfade taps directly into the nostalgia of the PS2 era while delivering the polish and fluidity expected from today’s action games. It’s a title aimed squarely at fans who miss when colorful, story-driven platformers were at the core of the PlayStation identity.

The game was recently featured in the New Game Plus Showcase, where a brand- new gameplay trailer and boss fight footage were revealed. The appearance was met with strong enthusiasm and positive reactions from major YouTube and Twitch creators.

Players don’t have to wait to experience it for themselves. A playable demo is currently available on Steam, holding a 91% positive rating, giving fans an early taste of Duskfade’s world, movement, and combat.

Duskfade is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam in 2026.
